events.name: Come Hang Out With Us At IT-ology!
events.description:
Google has given us an Android TV to play with and develop apps for. Join us to see how it works and brainstorm about new app ideas.

Look forward to seeing you there!

Tim Hill & James Kirk
GDG Columbia Organizers

events.name: Join us on April 7th at 6pm to learn more from Google!
events.description: I will update you on our February visit to Google.  Google has given us an Android TV to play with and develop apps for.  We also have PASSCON coupons to hand out.  An awesome deal! Join us to discuss Google Hackathons and to brainstorm about new app ideas for Android TV, Google Wearables, Chrome, YouTube, and more!
events.how_to_find_us: We meet in the Portal of the IT-ology building.  Take a left at the desk and we are in the far left corner.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Columbia!
events.description:
Google's I/O 2015 will be streamed live here in Columbia at ITology! Watch the keynote and select breakout activities such as code labs and a hackathon brought to us by the folks at 52apps. There will also be opportunities to hear tech talks from local IT gurus.  Join our I/O Extended event to experience all things Google with other developers and help us make a party of it!

There will be a raffle for a tablet, watch or Chromebook by completing a short event feedback survey. More details to come.﻿

Please RSVP here on Meetup, GDG Columbia, or on Google+.

events.name: Join us on Thursday, July 30th in Columbia!
events.description:
As the summer has taken most of you out of town we thought it would be a good idea for all of us that are stuck back home to work on making a few new contacts. 

We would also like to introduce our new co-organizers and give everyone an update on what we are planning for the remainder of the year such as Devfest and Women Techmakers. 

Food and beverages will be provided. You will have an opportunity to put your name in the hat for a few door prizes. 

Hope to see you all there!﻿

GDG Columbia
events.how_to_find_us: We are usually on the second floor in the Portal.  This may change for this event.

events.name: Join us for Google's Devfest 2015: Columbia!
events.description:
Devfest is an event put on by Google Developers Groups nationwide.  This is the first time Devfest will be held in Columbia, SC.  The event will feature tech talks by real Googlers including the following:

   • Session 1:  "Boosting Your Career With Google" with Elizabeth Padilla from Google

   • Session 2: "Marshmallow Challenge" with Donna Teuber - Google for Educators Lead, RD2

   • Session 3: "Firebase Talk" with Martin Omander from Google

   • Session 4: Android M

   • Session 5: Unconference

   • Code Lab 1: Android 101

   • Code Lab 2: Hacking Mindcraft (Grade School Level)

   • Code Lab 3: Hands-On with Firebase and Android

   • Code Lab 4: More Advanced Android

   • Code Lab 5: Web Session: Angular and Material Design

Take advantage of this Google event unique to Columbia!

This is a FREE event with lunch provided and several giveaways!

Devfest 2015: Columbia continues on October 28th with the WISE and Women Techmakers' Trends event at IT-ology.  Look for the announcement in a separate Meetup post.

events.name: AngularJS and Material Design Talk for Beginners
events.description:
Join us as we continue our session about AngularJS and Material Design presented at the recent Devfest-Columbia.  (Prior Devfest or GDG attendance is not required.) Billy Agee, Web Application Developer at ZVerse, Inc. will introduce AngularJS and Material Design and how they relate to mobile web applications. 

This is a FREE event with refreshments provided.

Why AngularJS?

HTML is great for declaring static documents, but it falters when we try to use it for declaring dynamic views in web-applications. AngularJS lets you extend HTML vocabulary for your application. The resulting environment is extraordinarily expressive, readable, and quick to develop.

What is Material Design?

Material Design is a specification for a unified system of visual, motion, and interaction design that adapts across different devices and different screen sizes.
events.how_to_find_us: In the Portal. First room on the left upon entering IT-ology on the 2nd floor.

events.name: Google's Android Study Jams
events.description:
Ever want to learn how to develop your own mobile apps?  GDG Columbia is offering a FREE Android course through Udacity.com, a $199 value.  This is a work at your own pace event that will kickoff on in person on Saturday, February 20th.  You will then work from home with weekly instructor support for 8 weeks.  The course will end on the 8th week with an event held Saturday, April 16th at SOCO.  

This course is designed for beginners and also for those with some programming experience.  All you will need is a laptop/computer.  

All course materials needed, Google swag and lunch will be provided.

This opportunity is free for the first 50 attendees.
events.how_to_find_us: Behind Jason's Deli on the second floor.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Columbia is Back!
events.description:
We're happy to announce this year's Google I/O Extended Columbia will be held in the IT-ology auditorium again this year! Thanks to USC/Columbia Technology Incubator. We will be releasing the schedule once Google lets us know the format.

Google I/O is Google's largest developer conference and draws thousands of attendees from all over the world each year. Join us for the second annual I/O Extended in Columbia, which will take place in the auditorium on the first floor.

Watch the Keynote Live from Google I/O 2016 with breakout sessions throughout the day. Food, fun and fabulous swag for all attendees. There will be a raffle for a tablet, watch or Chromebook by completing a short event feedback survey. Last years event was attended by 60 people! We are expecting close to 100 this year. Please RSVP here or in G+.﻿
events.how_to_find_us: This event will be held in the Auditorium on the 1st Floor.

events.name: FREE Google Progressive Web Apps Meetup
events.description:
Progressive Web Apps provide an app-like user experience. They can be launched from an icon on the home screen, render quickly, use hardware features such as GPS, and work offline.

This month's meetup is based on the Progressive Web App Dev Summit in Amsterdam. We will watch the keynote, a few break out videos, and then offer code labs that attendees can choose from and work through for the remainder of the event. A few prizes will also be given out at the end of the labs as well as some really Google swag.

Space is limited to 50 attendees.  Please RSVP here, Eventbrite, or in G+.
events.how_to_find_us: Look for us on the 2nd floor towards the right side once entering the space.

events.name: DevFest 2016
events.description:
**This is a FREE event, but space is limited.  RSVP to reserve your space.**

GDG DevFests are large, community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more. All of the content is from Google Developer Groups (GDG), and just like last year, we won't disappoint. 

All 60+ attendees who joined us for DevFest 2015 have been anticipating the next one.  We're happy to announce DevFest 2016 is scheduled for Nov 16th.  The times are subject to change depending on the venue.  

DevFest 2015 featured tech talks by Google representatives Martin Omander and Elizabeth Padella.  They discussed Boosting Your Career with Google and led a discussion about Firebase.  We also gave away plenty of Google logo items to all attendees!

Here is our current schedule of events.  Lunch will be provided.

Please RSVP in the meantime to reserve your spot.

-Tim Hill, GDG Columbia Lead Organizer

Update on goodies compliments of Google:
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the 2nd floor on the SC Cyber side opposite of IT-ology.

events.name: Google's Firebase Dev Summit Viewing Party!
events.description:
GDG Columbia and the Firebase team are sponsoring a Firebase Dev Summit Viewing Party! 

Come learn how to use Firebase with your apps! We'll start with a demo of how easy it is to add Firebase to your app, view some videos from the Firebase Dev Summit in Berlin, and end with a brief talk on some of the new developments in Firebase. There may be a little SWAG fresh from the Firebase team as well.

Refreshments will be provided.

events.name: Google Cloud Next '17 Extended - Columbia
events.description:
The future of cloud is now, at Next!

Get new ideas. Learn from industry experts. Engage with peers. Join us for an immersive event that brings together executives, customers, partners, developers, IT decision makers, and Google Engineers to build the future of the cloud. Choose from over 200 sessions on Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, Devices, and more.

The Keynote and Track 1 will be on the 2nd Floor.  All of the code labs will be on the 4th Floor and will start after the Keynote.

Here is the event schedule for this weekend...

events.name: Google I/O 2017 Livestream Presented by R2 Innovates
events.description:
Google I/O Livestream!, code labs, tech talks, Google SWAG and more!  Details are being worked out this week.  

About R2 Innovates

The R2 Innovates incubator and hub provides time, space and resources for teachers, staff and leaders to engage in action research, develop ideas, prototype, and scale innovations which support teaching, learning and the work environment.
events.how_to_find_us: Just past Plex Sports Center on left.  We will have signage in the building.

events.name: Kurious About Kubernetes?
events.description:
In this Meetup, we'll learn how to build a Slack bot using the Botkit toolkit and run it on Google Cloud Platform. You'll be able to interact with the bot in a live Slack channel.

What you'll learn:
=>Creating a bot custom integration in Slack.
=>Building a Node.js image in Docker.
=>Uploading a Docker image to a private Google Container Registry.
=>Running a Slack bot on Google Container Engine, a managed Kubernetes service.

events.name: Getting Started with Machine Learning Using TensorFlow
events.description:
TensorFlow was originally developed by researchers and engineers working on the Google Brain Team within Google's Machine Intelligence research organization for the purposes of conducting machine learning and deep neural networks research, but the system is general enough to be applicable in a wide variety of other domains as well.

As always, this is a free event and will feature a few giveaways from Google!

events.name: DevFest '17
events.description:
**This is a FREE event even though other GDGs around the country will be charging attendance to their DevFests.  Space is limited.  RSVP to reserve your space.**

GDG DevFests are large, community-run events that offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more. All of the content is from Google Developer Groups (GDG), and just like last year, we won't disappoint. We are still working on the details of this event and will provide updates as they are decided on. This also includes venue and date.

Topics will include among others Android, Firebase, Google Cloud, and Flutter among others. (See schedule below.)

**If you're interested in becoming a speaker for this or any of our other Google events, please send any of our organizers a private message.**

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jams!
events.description:
• What we'll do

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Join us to get official Google training, a $70+ value, FREE of charge!

Attendees will:

>Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.

>Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.

>Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).

>Get Google-hosted badges for their online profiles, to show potential employers what they know about Cloud computing.

• What to bring

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know

This is a kick-off session that will last about 3 hours. We will then adjourn where you will be able to complete 2-8 hours of self-paced, self-study on your own complete with a Slack channel for minor support. All attendees who finish will meet back together in about 30 days. (Date TBD)
events.how_to_find_us: A door code will be provided for that day to enter.

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended
events.description:
• What we'll do
The TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, & conversations with the TensorFlow team & community. Join us and learn from your local Google Developer Group leaders as we host several code labs designed for you. We will also stream select tech talks from the live summit.

As always, we will provide refreshments and really cool prizes!

More information will be provided as we get closer to the event date.

events.name: Google I/O '18 Extended Event!
events.description:
Join us as we recap the major updates and announcements from this year's Google IO event. We will be viewing the Keynote plus many other talks with open discussions of each. A more detailed schedule will be provided closer to the event.

Food, drinks and Google swag will be provided to all RSVPs.
events.how_to_find_us: Just left of Wild Wing Café

events.name: Google Cloud Next Extended
events.description:
Join GDG Columbia as we celebrate and learn about the exciting announcements at Google Cloud Next (https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/)! We will start off with some food and networking. We will then kick off with highlights from the event last week and transition to an open panel discussion.

Agenda to come.
events.how_to_find_us: Suite B down the alley to the left of Wild Wing Café.

events.name: Intro to Flutter & Study Jam Sessions
events.description:
We are going to have an Intro to Flutter development, and then follow it with a series of weekly Flutter Study Jam sessions.

A more detailed timeline for the Study Jam style sessions will be announced during this starting Meetup. Here is a short list covering what we are planning.
A Flutter Meetup - Installation, setup and first apps.
Hangout session each week following the Meetup - To discuss the next steps, assignments and challenges to code.
Slack channel discussions any day between the weekly Hangouts - To provide feedback, suggestions and assistance on the assignments and challenges.
As long as there is interest in the Hangouts and Slack channel, we will continue the Study Jam sessions.
Updates on the Study Jam during future Meetup events.

Slack Channels
GDGColaSC.Slack.com
GDGCloudColaSC.Slack.com

In the spring of 2018, Google announced the Flutter SDK Beta and developers have started to deploy applications to the Play Store and App Store.

Flutter SDK Timeline
February 2018 - Beta 1 - Launch announcement of the Flutter SDK for Android and iOS application development
April 2018 - Beta 2 - Improvements and Dart 2 enabled by default
July 2018 - Release Preview 1 - Bug fixes, stability and numerous new features
September 2018 - Release Preview 2 - Focused on iOS support
events.how_to_find_us: Suite B down the alley to the left of Wild Wing Café.

events.name: DevFest '18
events.description:
**This is a free event and will include food and several door prizes.**

DevFest is a worldwide Google event focussed on empowering local communities with the latest opensource developer tools. DevFest has become a huge success here in Columbia. We hope to continue this annual tradition with emerging technologies such as Machine Learning, TensorFlow, Google Cloud, Flutter, Angular, and many more!

This year's DevFest '18 will feature 8 speakers. 4 of which will be from our Woman Techmakers Group. They will be presenting the following topics:

=> "Designing a Better App with Design Thinking"
=> "Gamefying a Project"
=> "Finding Low-Cost Learning Resources for Personal and Tech Development"
=> "Learning Elm: Functional Web Development"

The guys at 52Inc will be presenting the following in addition to a few other topics:

=> "Kotlin Multiplatform Project" - An overview of building a mutli-platform project (Server, Android, iOS) using Kotlin
=> "APIs with Kotlin and Ktor" - An overview of building an API with Kotlin and Ktor.
=> "iOS vs Android"
=> "Cyber Kill Chain" - Steps Hackers Use to Gain Access
events.how_to_find_us: **Event is on the 2nd Floor**  There is a high school event on the 1st.

events.name: Tech Community Social
events.description: We will be hosting a tech community social hour at Casual Pint just before the Open Source SC event at SOCO. Everyone is invited to join us! This is a casual drop-in, so don't worry about being late. Just show up! We will then walk over to SOCO in time to support their event.

events.name: Hands-On Cloud Study Jam & IWD Event
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Tentative Agenda:
6:00pm: 3 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
7:30pm: Break
8:00pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
9:00pm: Event ends

events.name: Hands On Google Cloud Next ‘19 Extended
events.description:
This Meetup will be another 2 for 1 deal!

First, we will start by giving all attendees another 30-day FREE, all-you-can-eat access to Qwiklabs, $55+ value which includes 140+ labs. You will be able to Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise. No credit card required for registration.

If this is your first time working with Qwiklabs, we will walk you through setting up your account and offer tips to get you going. You will need to bring your laptop with Google Chrome preinstalled.

Secondly, we will share content from Google’s Cloud Next ‘19 event from this past week and discuss any takeaways.

Complimentary food and beverages will be available as well as door prizes for all!

events.name: Google I/O Live Stream Party!
events.description:
Join us as we stream the Keynote and interesting sessions from Google I/O '19! Learn about the highlights, new technology, and more.

Attendees can fill out a form if they are interested in Job opportunities at Google here.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe0K820D0O7pbvZvc-CsQAQx9JLONJRC0DPTgOinaDDQB6QCw/viewform

When answering which I/O Extended event are you participating in choose "other" for the drop-down regarding event location, then add "GDG Columbia" to the "Questions or Comments?" section.

events.name: Hands-on Flutter Study Jam!
events.description:
We are going to have an Intro to Flutter development, and then follow it with a series of weekly Flutter Study Jam sessions.

A more detailed timeline for the Study Jam style sessions will be announced soon. Here is a short list covering what we are planning.

> A Flutter Meetup - Installation, setup, and first apps.
> Hangout session each week following the Meetup - To discuss the next steps, assignments, and challenges to code.
> Slack channel discussions any day between the weekly Hangouts - To provide feedback, suggestions, and assistance on the assignments and challenges.

Here is a list of items to setup your Flutter environment prior to the event:
> Download and Install Android Studio (https://developer.android.com/studio)
> Start Android Studio, and go through the ‘Android Studio Setup Wizard’. This installs the latest Android SDK, Android SDK Platform-Tools, and Android SDK Build-Tools, which are required by Flutter when developing for Android.
> Go to Settings -> Plugins -> Type ‘Flutter’ in search bar under Marketplace -> Install the first result “Flutter” (it should be tagged as a ‘Language’)
> Restart Android Studio
You can also follow this guide to get setup and start playing with the framework: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Columbia
events.description:
**Attendees must register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kotlin-everywhere-columbia-tickets-64817344422

JetBrains and Google is coming together to host Kotlin Everywhere around the world - here in Columbia, 52Inc and Google Developer Group is collaborating to highlight and show Kotlin’s power across an entire stack from Mobile all the way to Backend.

We hope you will join us and enjoy this 3-hour event where we will walk through setting up your environment and go through a few JetBrains workshops! More schedule details to come!

This is an intro course, but some general knowledge is recommended. A laptop is mandatory. Certain free downloads may be required prior to the event to speed up time.

Space is extremely limited, so sign up early!

events.name: DevFest '19
events.description:
Going on 5 years, DevFest is Columbia's only FREE tech conference!

The line-up features 8 different speakers and a lightning round of talks you don't want to miss! Visit http://gdgcolumbia.org/devfest for the complete list and description of each speaker's session.

Be sure to get your FREE Eventbrite ticket for the event: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-19-tickets-71395220025 There is no need to register on both sites.

This year, we will have 10 sessions running two at a time AND a very unique hacking event (http://gdgcolumbia.org/images/Poster.pdf)

**As usual, food will be provided as well as a few door prizes at the end.**

Help us spread the word and make this the biggest GDG Columbia DevFest yet!

events.name: Flutter Interact Viewing and Holiday Party
events.description:
Flutter Interact is for UI and front-end developers hosted in NYC. GDG Columbia will be hosting a viewing party locally with a holiday theme.

Following a few short streaming tech talks from Flutter Interact we will move to a 30 min hands-on activity using Flutter Factory by Dartpad which is browser-based. No need for downloads. You can bring your laptop to participate or simply watch and learn.

Door prizes will be available in the form of free Flutter course coupons as well as holiday food and refreshments.

We will be on the first floor all the way around the right side.

Hope to see you there!

events.name: Progressive Web Apps (PWA)
events.description:
Join us for an introduction to Progressive Web Apps, what they are, how to build one including a tutorial of a simple PWA.

>What is a PWA
>How are the different from other web apps
>Benefits of PWAs
>Drawbacks of PWAs
>Tools needed to build a PWA
>Tutorial building a simple PWA

Food will be provided as well as a few door prizes.

ECPI University will be our venue sponsor for this event. Please note a different location than our usual space.

events.name: International Women's Day - "Setting Your 2020 Goals"
events.description:
Come enjoy an evening of getting to know your community and yourself. #TogetherWeRise

International Women’s Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women’s economic, political, and social achievements.

This International Women's Day, we’re inviting our community to share their superpowers - those special qualities that make you shine. Whether you’re creating space for more voices to be heard or you’re working to secure funding as an entrepreneur, you’re a superhero in our book. Together let’s celebrate the super-women in our lives. Together let’s create a new narrative for our industry.

We have created a value-packed evening for your including several intriguing speakers lined up, a few activities planned, and as always, great SWAG and refreshments! While this is a women-focused event, all are welcome.

Meeting Agenda

-Networking/Social
-Welcome (6:10 pm)
-Video - Laura Vanderkam, How to Gain Control of Your Free Time
-Speaker: Carmen Adamson, Brand Manager, DPX Technologies
-Activity: Define your goals for 2020
-Speaker: Anita Garrett, Chief Strategy Officer, The Weathers Group
-Activity: Break your goals into doable steps
-Speaker: Caroline Crowder, Program Director, USC Columbia Technology Incubator
-Activity: Put the next steps on your schedule
-Closing, Door Prizes

Please RSVP on Meetup AND Eventbrite to reserve your spot!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/international-womens-day-columbia-tickets-94846019999

upcoming.name: Cancelled: Google Cloud Next Extended
upcoming.description:
Google has decided to cancel both Google Cloud Next '20 and Google Cloud Next ‘20: Digital Connect. It is with a heavy heart we are forced to cancel our Extended event as well.

We are currently looking into streaming our future events until things get back to normal. Please stay tuned for more information about how you can view our virtual events.

Thanks!

-Tim

organizers.name: Dayton
organizers.bio: I have lived in Columbia for more than 34 years.  I got my BS in Statistics from USC.  I was in Scouts and I got my Eagle Scout in 1991.  I worked at The Backpacker while in college and still work there part time on occasion.

organizers.name: Tim H.
organizers.bio: Owner of the advertising agency Hill Company.  I have over 15 years experience in advertising, public relations, creative design, and web design.  I enjoy helping small to medium size businesses market themselves better.

group_profile.intro: I have a Bachelors Degree in business and own my own advertising agency.  I've always had a passion for technology.  With this group I'm looking to pair myself with others in the community with the same desire for new technology.

organizers.name: Drew H.
organizers.bio:
Lead Android Engineer @ 52inc

I love all things Android and gaming and an overall passion for software development. My current passion is for growing violently hot chile peppers and making them into hot sauces.
